Applying VIOS 2.2.4.22 updates from a remotely mounted file system

Apply 2.2.4.20

  1. Check if rootvg has atleast 30G of free space
    lsvg rootvg
  2. Mount the remote directory onto the Virtual I/O Server.
    oem_setup_env

    Then 

    mkdir /mnt
mount 10.0.48.12:/prod/images/vio/vios2/fixpacks /mnt
  3. Login as padmin to commit previous updates, by running the updateios command.
    su - padmin
    updateios -commit
  4. Apply the update by running the updateios command.
    updateios -accept -install -dev /mnt/VIOS_SP_2.2.4.20

    Rerun it if bos.rte fileset has been upgraded.

  5. To load all changes, reboot the VIOS as user padmin .
     shutdown -force -restart
  6. Verify that the update was successful by checking the results of the updateios command and by running the ioslevel command, which should indicate that the ioslevel is now 2.2.4.20.
    ioslevel
  7. Run the license acept command for all upgrades
    license -accept
  8. Commit all the updates 
    updateios -commit

  1. Mount the remote directory onto the Virtual I/O Server.
    oem_setup_env

    Then

  3. Apply the update by running the updateios command.

    Rerun it if bos.rte fileset has been upgraded.

  4. To load all changes, reboot the VIOS as user padmin .
     shutdown -force -restart
  5. Verify that the update was successful by checking the results of the updateios command and by running the ioslevel command, which should indicate that the ioslevel is now 2.2.4.22
    ioslevel
  6. Run the license acept command for all upgrades
    license -accept
  7. Commit all the updates
